artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Iseya Kanekichi; Carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: portrait of a woman looking toward PL, with open mouth; woman wears a green kimono with blue, yellow and pink flowers; landscape behind woman with mountain peaks and trees primarily in ULQ
inscription: 三輪の山　いかに待みん　年ふとも　尋る人も　あらじと思へば {Mowa no yama / Ika ni machi min / Toshi fu tomo / Tazuneru hito mo / Araji to omoe ba} (How shall I wait / Long enough to see him come / To Miwa Mountain? / I know well the yeras will pass / And there will be no visitor) (Translated by Edwin A. Craston)
markings: date seal: 子十 {ne jū} (Rat 10) | censor seals: 福 {Fuku} | 村松 {Muramatsu} | publisher\'s seal: {Isekane} | carver\'s seal: {hori Take}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Visual Parody of the Thirty-Six Selected Poets (Mitate sanjūrokkasen no uchi 見立三十六歌撰之内)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: Poem by Ise: (Actor Onoe Baikō IV as) Kumagai's Wife Sagami
